notes_display: Traces of mount at 2 h; Obv./rev. blind spot, slightly double struck
issue_obverse_figure_s: Right profile of Wahram IV on frontal bust
issue_obverse_figure_description_s: crown with mural element, crescent above forehead; covered korymbos; two ribbons commencing to the left below the korymbos, pointing upwards; pearl diadem, diadem ribbons commencing below ball of hair, pointing upwards; earing consisting of two elements; neck-line of tunica edged with a row of pearls; floral elements bwlow bust; double row of pearls running from the shoulders to the breast ornament (only upper part visible); dotted border
issue_reverse_figure_description_s: base consisting of two elements; round altar shaft; on the shaft l'st (rƒÅst, "just"); to the left and right of the shaft ribbons pointing downwards, three altar slabs; alter flames, rendered by three tiers of four, three and two strokes respectively; to the left and right of altar attendant with stylized crown of Yazdgerd I, holding a barsom with both hands, dotted border
issue_references_s: SNS 3 Uncertain Mint Type Ib1/1a, var. 6 var. two crescents to the right of altar flames
